Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There didn't need to be too much dialogue to convey what you wanted. Anita Greene(Anita's mother Patricia Love) and Christine Love could've done a dance number together, perhaps during the day when Rose(Christine Love)air free whilst on the beach. Just a suggestion.

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as "My Own Private Idaho" by Gus Van Sack and reworked again for "Will and Grace. The movie is filled with pranks and enough humorous lines to enjoy the story with multiple foundictions.
